skills.name: Substitute positive integer values into expressions involving no powers or roots
Substitute positive integer values into expressions involving powers or roots
Substitute negative integer values into expressions involving powers or roots
Calculate speed where distance and time are in the appropriate units
Substitute positive integer values into formulae involving powers or roots

explanations.A: I think you made a slight mistake when working out 4k. Remember this means 4 x k.
explanations.C: I think you have multiplied k by 2 rather than squaring it. k² means k x k
explanations.D: Almost, but remember that for 3k² you have to do the k² first, and then multiply by 3

explanations.A: I think you put 3k as 33. Remember this means 3 x k.
explanations.B: I think you put 3k as 33. Remember this means 3 x k. You then need to make sure you do the subtraction in the right order.
explanations.C: Really close, but I think you added rather than taking away

explanations.A: I think you found the first part correctly, but remember that 4r means 4 x r
explanations.B: Think really carefully about what happens when you multiply two negatives together, and what happens when you subtract a negative.
explanations.D: I think you worked out each part, but just think carefully about what happens when you subtract a negative.

explanations.B: Think really carefully about what happens when you multiply two negatives together, and what happens when you subtract a negative.
explanations.C: Think really carefully about what happens when you multiply two negatives together, and what happens when you subtract a negative.
explanations.D: Think really carefully about what happens when you multiply two negatives together, and what happens when you subtract a negative.

explanations.B: I think you have multiplied the numbers, but we need to do the distance divided by the time
explanations.C: I think you have done time divided by distance, it needs to be distance divided by time
explanations.D: It would only be 4 metres per hour if the snail travelled 4 metres in 1 hour. You need to do the distance divided by the time.

explanations.A: I think you made a mistake with the division. What is 3 divided by 6?
explanations.B: I think you did time divided by distance, but it needs to be distance divided by time
explanations.C: Distance is 3m, and time is 6 hours, so the speed is 3/6 = 0.5 metres per hour.
explanations.D: It would only be 3 metres per hour if the snail travelled 3 metres in 1 hour. You need to do the distance divided by the time.

explanations.B: Nearly, just remember that cw means you have to multiply the c and w together
explanations.C: I think you divided before you took off the y. You need to work out all of the top of the fraction before dividing by the bottom number
explanations.D: I think you only divided the y by w. You need to work out all of the top of the fraction before dividing by the bottom.

explanations.A: I think you only divided the a by b. You need to work out all of the top of the fraction before dividing by the bottom.
explanations.B: Almost, just remember that cb means you multiply c and b together
explanations.C: I think you divided before you added the a. You need to work out all of the top of the fraction before dividing by the bottom number

explanations.B: I think you substituted into the first part of the expression, but forgot to +3
explanations.C: I think you tried substituting in 4 rather than 3
explanations.D: The numbers don't go up by the same amount each time. You need to change r for 3 and then work out the sum

explanations.A: The numbers don't go up by the same amount each time. You need to change r for 3 and then work out the sum
explanations.C: Not quite, I think you substituted in 4 rather than 3.
explanations.D: Not quite, I think you doubled rather than squared. Remember, r² means r x r.
